CatDescriptText: Mr. Andrew Glover, office worker, Waring Court, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column, published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 8, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "Do you think that women should wear Bermuda or walking shorts, or similar apparel, while walking along the streets?" answer reads: "In the city, I'm opposed to the wearing of shorts. But I can understand home, near the home, or in the parks."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Andrew Glover wearing light colored polo shirt with dark stripe on collar, coat draped over arm, standing in front of store window
